items.title: Homes for Sale in New York City
items.abstract: This weeks homes are in Greenwich Village, Manhattanville and the Financial District.

items.title: Priced Out of the City, They Bought a Tiny Suburban Home. Now What?
items.abstract: The 900-square-foot house had three bedrooms, but the children’s were shoe-box size. Updating them required ingenuity and ideas from “An American in Paris.”

items.title: Where Can You Find a No-Fee Rental?
items.abstract: A median-priced New York City rental apartment could come with a broker’s fee of nearly $7,000.

items.title: How Do You Get a High-Style House for $600,000? Build It Yourself.
items.abstract: One Washington State couple worked side by side with their contractors, doing much of the heavy lifting: “We wanted to do something extraordinary.”

items.title: New York City Will Finally Turn a Hotel Into Housing
items.abstract: Developers announced a plan to transform a Hilton hotel near Kennedy International Airport into affordable housing — the first conversion to take place through a pandemic-era state program.
